Top-3 Similar Questions: su_1245540: Alias does not "override" PATH entries?
ul_57443: cp -f cannot overwrite cp -i alias

Explanations about Options.-i: prompt before overwrite (overrides a previous -n option)
Explanations about Options.-f:
if an existing destination file cannot be opened, remove it and try again (this
 option is ignored when the -n option is also used)

Top-3 Similar Questions: ul_47341: Are there any utilities to quickly add, list and remove command aliases?
so_63928747: How can I update my bash profile to include an alias?
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_47341: help alias

$ alias savealias='alias > ~/.bash-aliases'
$ savealias

alias acs='apt-cache show'
alias acss='apt-cache search'
alias loadalias='. ~/.bash-aliases '
alias mq='mailq | grep "^[0-9A-Z]"'
alias savealias='alias >~/.bash-aliases'
alias ttystat='echo $(tty) $TERM ${COLUMNS}x$LINES'
alias where='type -all'
alias which='type -path'
